Okay,

At the end, i found out my mistake !! That was coming from the
secur=
ity manager (The exception was not given by the getResource call
but i foun=
d it using an other way). It seems that Eclipse use a
specific way to launc=
h JUnit Test (through its plugin and a socket
connection) and Eclipse Junit=
 plugin codebase (defined into java
policy file) was not allowed to read my=
 config file (retrieved by
getResource). So i added the following:

grant c=
odeBase "file:/usr/local/eclipse/plugins/-" {
     //For Junit
     permiss=
ion java.net.SocketPermission "*:1024-",
"connect,accept,listen,resolve";
 =
   //for my config
    permission java.io.FilePermission "/path/to/my/confi=
g/-", "read";
};

And now it works...
Hope it could help others too !

Jo=
=EBl
